description.content: Get details of a cart linked to a specific customer using a unique cart ID. It offers an overview of the items, quantities, prices, and other relevant information associated with the cart.

query.description: The unique identifier of the cart.
Select `true` to retrieve all the items added in the cart.
Select `true` to retrieve the price breakup of cart items.
Select `true` to retrieve the cod charges in breakup of cart items.
Token of user's debit or credit card.
Customer servicable area_code.
Select `true` to set/initialize buy now cart.
The order type of shipment HomeDelivery - If the customer wants the order home-delivered PickAtStore - If the customer wants the handover of an order at the store itself.

header.description: Ordering source header, to be used to identify source of order creation.

response.name: Success. Returns a Cart object. Check the example shown below or refer `CartDetailResult` for more details.

header.description: Ordering source header, to be used to identify source of order creation.

item.name: getCartLastModified | Get last modified timestamp of a cart

request.name: getCartLastModified | Get last modified timestamp of a cart

description.content: Retrieve the last modified timestamp of the cart using unique cart ID. It indicates the most recent update made to the cart's content or properties.

query.description: The unique identifier of the cart.

response.name: Success. Receives last modifed timestamp in the header.

item.name: addItems | Add items to a cart

request.name: addItems | Add items to a cart

description.content: Add product items to the customer's existing shopping cart. If there is no existing cart associated with the customer, it creates a new one and adds the items to it.

query.description: Select `true` to retrieve all the items added in the cart.
Select `true` to retrieve the price breakup of cart items.
Customer servicable area_code.
Select `true` to set/initialize buy now cart.
The unique identifier of the cart.
The order type of shipment HomeDelivery - If the customer wants the order home-delivered PickAtStore - If the customer wants the handover of an order at the store itself.

header.description: Ordering source header, to be used to identify source of order creation.

response.name: Success. Returns a cart object as shown below. Refer `AddCartDetailResult` for more details.

header.description: Ordering source header, to be used to identify source of order creation.

description.content: Starts the process of uploading a file to storage location, and returns a signed url in response.

variable.description:
(Required) A classification value that categorizes files based on the namespace used to determine their storage location and validate their data before upload. The namespace  also acts as a directory structure within the storage bucket and enforces file-specific rules.
Available namespaces:
  - misc: Public namespace allowing all file types up to 100Mb
  - user-profile-pic: Public namespace allowing images up to 15Mb
  - feedback-media: Public namespace allowing images and videos up to 1Gb
  - users-vto-images: Private namespace allowing images up to 40Mb
  - application-audience: Private namespace allowing images and PDFs up to 50Mb
